titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Office of Public Affairs, Yale University, Motion Pictures
Office of Public Affairs, Yale University, Motion Pictures
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 24, 2019 at 08:13

did.unittitle: Office of Public Affairs, Yale University, motion pictures

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The materials consist of video recordings, notes, statements, motion picture film, stock film, sound tracks, and magnetic tapes used in Office of Public Affairs (formerly Public Information) productions documenting Yale. Many of the video recordings in Accession 2009-A-156 are commercially produced by entities external to Yale.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale University. Office of Public Affairs

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 48-B (YRG 48-B), Yale audiovisual records and collections.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Copies of the final films produced for distribution are catalogued individually.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Office of Public Affairs, Yale University, Motion Pictures (RU 840). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of video recordings, notes, statements, motion picture film, stock film, sound tracks, and magnetic tapes used in Office of Public Affairs (formerly Public Information) productions documenting Yale. Many of the video recordings in Accession 2009-A-156 are commercially produced by entities external to Yale.

controlaccess.corpname: Yale University. Office of Public Affairs

University Public Information motion picture films of Yale events and student life

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reappraised and processed by Barbara Fiddler and Stephen Cohen, 2002.

Note: Films and production records listed below, were originally attributed to Yale University Films since Manuscripts and Archives staff packed up their records in 1991. Research on the films reveals them to come from various units on campus. Because of the medium, they all ended up at Yale University Films. The films are now reassigned to RUs that more accurately reflect their creation and original purpose.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Most of the audiovisual items in this accession are commercially-produced. Copies of commercially-produced items cannot be made for researcher use outside of the repository.
